author: iheart.com
title: South Carolina Eatery Crowned The Best Mom & Pop Restaurant In The State | 104.7 WNOK
text:
Photo: GMVozd/E+/Getty Images
Chain restaurants and popular eateries are great, but there's something about sitting down at a locally famous hole-in-the-wall or a longtime favorite mom and pop shop that has been serving up tried and true delicious meals for years that just hits home.
Using reviews, awards and accolades as well as first-hand experience, LoveFood compiled a list of the "best mom and pop restaurant" in every state, eateries that have been a mainstay of the community for decades or establishments that serve up family recipes that have been perfected over several generations.
According to the site, the best mom and pop restaurant in all of South Carolina is Sweatman's Bar-B-Que, an eatery in Holly Hill that serves some of the best BBQ around. Sweatman's , located at 1427 Eutaw Road, has a 4.5 star rating on Google and nearly 1,000 reviews.
Here's what the site had to say about this restaurant offering "incredible comfort food":
"Barbecue is a way of life in South Carolina, but there's something really special about this sweet spot in Holly Hill, which has been serving hungry diners since 1959. The original 1950s location eventually closed, but this cute farmhouse venue opened in 1977 â€” and it's been cooking up a storm ever since. Faithful punters come in for the oak, hickory, and pecan-smoked pork, which comes doused in a secret-recipe sauce." Check out the full list at lovefood.com to read up on more of the best mom and pop restaurants in the country.

author: @nickcla32947083
title: Rocherlea man's police chase ends with arrest | The Examiner | Launceston, TAS
text:
A Rocherlea man grabbed two firearms from his car as he tried to run from police after an evade police incident, the Launceston Magistrates Court heard.
Damien Michael Milburn, 34, pleaded guilty to a raft of driving, firearms and family violence charges committed early this year.
Police prosecutor Dee Wadley said that on March 30, 2025, Milburn was driving a black Holden Commodore on Lilydale Rd.
The vehicle's number plate did not match that of a black car, but a Ford Territory, so they attempted to intercept it.
"The defendant refused to pull over and increased his speed," she said.
He stopped at an address in King Billy Crescent and jumped a fence. She said he had two firearms.
"As he was running away, he dropped a firearm, and he threw one into 7 King Billy Crescent," she said.
Police caught him, but he resisted arrest, later telling police he did not want to be arrested.
A search located 38 grams of methamphetamine, two snaplock bags of methylamphetamine powder and crystal (ice), a snaplock bag of suboxone and a Gerber knife.
"The firearms thrown into 7 King Billy Crescent had a round in the chamber," she said.
Milburn told police he had painted the car black.
The court heard that a ballistics report would show whether the firearms were in working order.
Milburn was a disqualified driver and the subject of a firearms prohibition order at the time.
On January 31, police intercepted him when he had 27 grams of cannabis bud in his possession.
Ms Wadley told magistrate Sharon Cure that Milburn had breached a five month suspended jail term with the offences.
The court heard that Milburn had been given the benefit of drug treatment orders in 2013 and 2017, which allowed him to avoid jail.
Defence lawyer Mark Doyle said Milburn had previously had a defeatist attitude to the orders and believed he could not extract himself from the drug lifestyle because everyone knew he was involved in drugs.
He said there were signs Milburn was ready to change.
Ms Cure said he had spent an awful lot of time in custody.
"It's just a sad waste of a life, at 34 years of age, he has just been in and out of jail," she said.
Ms Cure said that Milburn would probably have to serve the five-month suspended sentence and ordered that he be assessed for a drug treatment order.
He was remanded in custody to reappear for sentence on May 1, at 2.15 pm.
Ms Cure said he was a "walk-up start" to be declared a serial family violence offender.

author: ondaceroes | agencias
title: Las negociaciones para el alto el fuego en Gaza avanzan y se acercan a un principio de acuerdo
text:
Las negociaciones para alcanzar un alto el fuego en la Franja de Gaza avanzan positivamente y se acercan a un principio de acuerdo, si bien las partes todavÃ­a no han cerrado ningÃºn pacto definitivo, informaron este sÃ¡bado a EFE fuentes conocedoras de las conversaciones que tienen lugar en El Cairo.
Una fuente palestina dijo a EFE, bajo condiciÃ³n de anonimato, que "hay un gran avance en las negociaciones entre el movimiento palestino HamÃ¡s e Israel", y detallÃ³ que la delegaciÃ³n egipcia en el proceso negociador "ha alcanzado una formulaciÃ³n acordada en cuanto a los puntos de discrepancia".
PrecisÃ³ que el Ãºltimo acuerdo sobre el que discuten actualmente incluye una primera fase de 40 dÃ­as de tregua en la que se liberarÃ¡n 33 rehenes del total de unos 128 rehenes israelÃ­es retenidos por HamÃ¡s, mientras que el EjÃ©rcito israelÃ­ se retirarÃ¡ de las zonas en las que estÃ© presente en la Franja de Gaza.
SegÃºn esta misma fuente, la segunda fase continuarÃ¡ por otro periodo de 42 dÃ­as durante el cual se liberarÃ¡n todos los rehenes restantes y se extenderÃ¡ un proceso de "calma permanente en Gaza", mientras que la tercera y la Ãºltima fase incluirÃ¡ intercambiar los cadÃ¡veres y durarÃ¡ tambiÃ©n 42 dÃ­as.
TambiÃ©n apuntÃ³ que "(Sinwar) quiere un compromiso estadounidense por escrito para el fin incondicional de los combates" y solicita tambiÃ©n que Israel no impida regresar al territorio ocupado de Cisjordania a los palestinos liberados a cambio de los rehenes.
SegÃºn un alto funcionario de HamÃ¡s citado por la cadena catarÃ­ Al Yazira, el hecho de que Netanyahu insista en que Israel entrarÃ¡ en la ciudad de Rafah con independencia de un posible acuerdo es un "elemento clave" que tambiÃ©n se estÃ¡ discutiendo hoy en las conversaciones.
Hasta el momento, en el enclave palestino, al menos 32 personas fallecieron en las Ãºltimas 24 horas, lo que elevÃ³ a 34.654 el nÃºmero de vÃ­ctimas mortales registradas en los hospitales del enclave, ademÃ¡s de mÃ¡s de 77.900 heridos, segÃºn datos del Ministerio de Sanidad gazatÃ­, dependiente de HamÃ¡s.

author: Sumit Kumar
title: Los Angeles Tunnel Collapse: 31 Workers Rescued in Wilmington Construction Disaster
text:
A minimum of 31 employees have been rescued safely after a tunnel collapse in Wilmington, a Los Angeles suburb, on Wednesday night. The accident reportedly took place at approximately 8 p.m. when work was underway on the Los Angeles Effluent Outfall Tunnel project, NBC Los Angeles has reported.
The Los Angeles Fire Department (LAFD) has indicated that the laborers were retrieved from the underground in batches of eight through the use of a crane based at the site of construction. To date, there have been no reported injuries.
The City of Los Angeles has mobilized resources to the tunnel collapse in Wilmington,â€ Mayor Karen Bass posted on X. â€œOver 100 LAFD responders have been dispatched, including Urban Search and Rescue teams. Thank you to all of those who are taking action immediately to respond to this emergency.â€
LAFD has just reported that all workers who were trapped in the tunnel in Wilmington are now out and accounted for.
I just spoke with many of the workers who were trapped. Thank you to all of our brave first responders who acted immediately. You are L.A.â€™s true heroes.
[pic.twitter.com/6hdAwbH1MI]â€” Mayor Karen Bass (@MayorOfLA)
[July 10, 2025]
Massive Emergency Response Underway After Tunnel Collapse
The tunnel collapse occurred at the $630.5 million Los Angeles Effluent Outfall Tunnel project. The project is a wastewater management undertaking commissioned by the Los Angeles County Sanitation District. Flatiron Dragados, the projectâ€™s prime contractor, says the tunnel is roughly seven miles long and 18 feet in diameter. It is situated approximately 450 feet below ground level.
31 construction workers rescued about an hour after a tunnel collapse caused by structural failure in Los Angeles
[pic.twitter.com/PnsVOBfnju]â€” TRT World Now (@TRTWorldNow)
[July 10, 2025]
Early reports suggested that 15 workers were trapped after the collapse. LAFD officials later confirmed 31 workers had been rescued with no injuries reported. Meanwhile, footage from the scene revealed a full-scale emergency response operation, with cranes and confined space rescue units actively working on site.
â€œUp to 15 tunnel workers have been reported originally isolated by a â€˜collapseâ€™ in an (undetermined depth or diameter) industrial tunnel as many as six miles south of the response address, the only tunnel access,â€ LAFD stated in a formal release. â€œNo injuries have been confirmed.â€
The building collapsed at the corner of W. Lomita Boulevard and S. Figueroa Street in Wilmington. In response, LAFD dispatched over 100 personnel to the incident site. The team included Urban Search and Rescue units with specialized training for confined space tunnel rescues.
Project Timeline and Investigation
According to reports by the Los Angeles County Sanitation Department in July 2024, tunneling was initially expected to be completed this year. Nevertheless, the entire project is set to complete in 2027. The reason behind the collapse is still under investigation and has not yet been determined. Details about the tunnelâ€™s condition have not been reported.

author: BNN Correspondents
title: Mozambique's Gas Revolution: Emeritus International Leads the Charge in Cabo Delgado
text:
In the heart of Southern Africa, a transformative energy movement is underway, with Mozambique's burgeoning gas projects at its core. Emeritus International, a key player in this energy revolution, is setting its sights on the gas-rich Cabo Delgado province, aiming to secure a foothold in what is considered the continent's most significant gas ventures this decade. As the world's eyes turn to Mozambique, the nation's gas fields, notably the Pande-Temane Complex and the Mozambique Secunda Pipeline operated by Rompco, become crucial arteries pumping vitality into the region's economy and beyond.
The Pulse of Economic Growth: Mozambique's Gas Projects
Mozambique, with its vast reserves of natural gas, is on a fast track to becoming a global energy giant. The country's Pande-Temane Complex and the pivotal Mozambique Secunda Pipeline, which boasts a capacity of about 212 petajoules a year, are not just infrastructural feats but lifelines to economic resurgence and social development across Southern Africa. Operated by Rompco, the pipeline is a testament to regional collaboration, efficiently connecting gas fields to hungry markets in South Africa, and facilitating a crucial transition from coal to cleaner energy sources.
Emeritus International: A Conduit for Stability and Growth
Amid this backdrop of potential and ambition, Emeritus International emerges as a strategic investor, keen on leveraging the explosive growth of Mozambique's gas sector. By zeroing in on the Cabo Delgado province, the company is not merely investing in gas; it is betting on Africa's future. Emeritus's approach is multifaceted, combining the provision of security for these national assets with a savvy investment strategy that harnesses competitive capital. This not only bolsters its financial stability and credit rating but also aligns with stringent regulatory frameworks. The outcome? A ripple effect of benefits including increased business retention, a stimulated local economy, and a fortified market position.
Challenges and Opportunities Ahead
However, the road to energy dominance is fraught with challenges. Industry officials and companies, including those involved in the awarding of a long-term concession for a liquefied natural gas (LNG) project in Mozambique, have voiced concerns over timelines and potential gas shortages. With plans for new gas-to-power projects on the horizon and the necessity to secure gas supply by 2026, the stakes couldn't be higher. Emeritus International, recognizing these hurdles, is not deterred. Instead, it sees an unparalleled opportunity to diversify income sources across African markets, creating a stable financial bedrock upon which the future of Southern Africa's energy landscape can be built.
In conclusion, as Mozambique continues to solidify its status as a powerhouse in the global gas sector, the role of companies like Emeritus International cannot be overstated. Through strategic investment, a commitment to regional development, and an eye on long-term sustainability, Emeritus is not just participating in Mozambique's energy narrativeâ€”it's helping to write it. With the Pande-Temane Complex and the Mozambique Secunda Pipeline as vital components of this story, the promise of economic renewal and energy security for Southern Africa shines brightly on the horizon, heralding a new era of prosperity.

title: Brighton golea y acaba con la racha positiva del Tottenham en la Premier League â€“ PeriÃ³dico ZÃ³calo | Noticias de Saltillo, TorreÃ³n, Piedras Negras, Monclova, AcuÃ±a
text:
Londres.- Cuando parecÃ­a recompuesto, con tres victorias consecutivas, el Tottenham se tambaleÃ³, completÃ³ un primer tiempo decepcionante y recayÃ³ con una derrota concluyente frente al Brighton ; un batacazo con un 2-0 en 22 minutos y un golazo posterior del ecuatoriano PervÃ­s EstupiÃ±Ã¡n que limitÃ³ su posterior reacciÃ³n (4-2).
El Tottenham no estÃ¡ preparado para competir por la Premier. HabrÃ¡ que ver si por la clasificaciÃ³n para la Champions. Su irregularidad es una rÃ©mora, como visibilizÃ³ de nuevo en el estadio Amex.
No hay matices. Su puesta en escena fue un desastre . Dos goles a toda velocidad no admiten ninguna disculpa en un equipo que pretende ser una alternativa a lo mÃ¡ximo en la nueva era iniciada sin Harry Kane. El inicio lo apuntÃ³ a las cotas mÃ¡s ambiciosas. El presente lo ha rebajado. EstÃ¡ a seis puntos del liderato . Fue mucho peor la sensaciÃ³n en el terreno.
El 1-0 fue de Hinshelwood . Minuto 12. El lateral de 18 aÃ±os del Brighton, internacional inglÃ©s en las categorÃ­as inferiores, apenas doce encuentros en el conjunto profesional de su actual club, sumÃ³ su segundo tanto de la campaÃ±a con un control y un derechazo dentro del Ã¡rea que sobrepasÃ³ a Vicario , salvador formidable un rato antes ante Danny Welbeck.
El 2-0 fue de Joao Pedro . De penalti. Minuto 22. Lo cometiÃ³ Kulusevksi cuando el propio Welbeck se disponÃ­a a cazar un balÃ³n en el Ã¡rea tras un barullo. Es una pena mÃ¡xima inadmisible en tiempos de VAR. Su agarrÃ³n, el nÃ­tido y excesivo tirÃ³n de la camiseta sobre el atacante rival, fue tan evidente que la mera revisiÃ³n del video no admitÃ­a ninguna duda.
Y gracias para el Tottenham , que respirÃ³ cuando el poste repeliÃ³ el lanzamiento de James Milner desde el borde del Ã¡rea, en el minuto 31, o cuando el Ã¡rbitro decretÃ³ invÃ¡lido el 3-0 por la posiciÃ³n en fuera de juego de Buonanotte. Era tan solo el minuto 37.
Una seÃ±al de supervivencia del Tottenham. La mejor noticia era una desventaja aÃºn solo de dos goles, por mÃ¡s que fuera ya amplia. Y un segundo tiempo para resarcirse.
Ya en la segunda mitad era otro Tottenham , mÃ¡s cerca de su versiÃ³n, mÃ¡s prÃ³ximo a su nivel, mÃ¡s competitivo , mÃ¡s ofensivo, mÃ¡s desbordanteâ€¦ Superior entonces al Brighton. Cuando ya celebraba Richarlison el 2-1, la bandera arriba del asistente lo desconsolÃ³. Otra vez estaba en fuera de juego, como en dos de sus cuatro oportunidades anteriores, del que se fue reemplazado tras el 3-0, que llegÃ³ de forma inesperada instantes despuÃ©s.
De pronto, Pervis EstupiÃ±Ã¡n soltÃ³ un trallazo . Un zurdazo maravilloso con el que se inventÃ³ el 3-0, pero tambiÃ©n sofocÃ³ ya definitivamente cualquier reacciÃ³n del Tottenham, aÃºn a media hora del final. Vicario volÃ³ a por el balÃ³n. No le alcanzÃ³. El lateral ecuatoriano, de vuelta un mes despuÃ©s, alojÃ³ la pelota en la escuadra. La confirmaciÃ³n del Brighton. Mucho DÃ­a de los Inocentes, pero este golazo no es de broma. ðŸ˜±ðŸ‘€

El penalti cometido por Lo Celso, en el campo desde el 3-0, en sustituciÃ³n de Richarlison, fue el enÃ©simo despropÃ³sito del Tottenham, que recibiÃ³ el 4-0 de Joao Pedro . Un batacazo, aligerado por el 4-1 de Alejo VÃ©liz en el 81, el 4-2 de Ben Davies en el 85 y una ofensiva final, con un tiro al poste de Hojbjerg, que puso aÃºn mÃ¡s en evidencia su primer tiempo . author: Bitcoinist
title: Beware! OKX Exchange Issues Warning Over Harmful Firefox Extension
text:
Seychelles-based OKX has issued a warning about the proliferation of unauthorized OKX wallet add-ons, which are currently available in the Firefox plug-in store. According to user reports, the fake browser extension adds a third-party functionality within the siteâ€™s browser interface.
Although Firefoxâ€™s plug-in store has recorded less than 100 downloads as of this writing, the crypto exchange immediately issued a statement warning users that it had not released any Firefox browser extensions.
OKX management immediately responded to the reports of fake extensions and used its official Twitter/X page to warn and advise its users. In a post shared on January 8th, OKX stated that the company has not formally released an official browser extension for its wallet and asked those who mistakenly downloaded the extension to secure and move their digital assets immediately.
ã€é‡è¦å…¬å‘Šã€‘æˆ‘ä»¬æ³¨æ„åˆ°è¿‘æœŸ Firefox æµè§ˆå™¨æ’ä»¶å•†åŸŽä¸­å‡ºçŽ°äº†å‡å†’çš„ OKX Wallet æ’ä»¶ï¼Œè¯·æ³¨æ„ï¼šOKX å®˜æ–¹ç›®å‰å°šæœªå‘å¸ƒä»»ä½• Firefox æ’ä»¶
å¦‚æžœæ‚¨å·²ç»ä½¿ç”¨è¯¥æ¶æ„æ’ä»¶è¯·ç«‹å³è½¬ç§»ç›¸å…³é’±åŒ…èµ„äº§ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å·²ç»å°±æ­¤å‘ Firefox å®˜æ–¹æŠ•è¯‰ã€‚â€¦ pic.twitter.com/GjImvSA35l
â€” OKXä¸­æ–‡ (@okxchinese) January 8, 2025
OKX added that that they have already submitted a complaint to Firefox. The team further suggested that users download any plug-ins on its official website and asked its followers to report any suspected fake products or tools.
Fake browser extensions are a growing problem online and have a huge impact on the financial community. Malicious browser extensions, like the fake OKX wallet add-ons, may allow unauthorized access to financial information, account credentials, and other data.
Reports have shown that bad actors also use these fake browser extensions for phishing activities that aim to trick users into sharing their login information.
Over $1 Billion Lost To Phishing Scams In 2024According to Certik, hackers used phishing to steal cryptocurrencies from unsuspecting victims in 2024. In its Hack3d: The Web3 Security Report 2024, the security firm shared a list of costly and notorious crypto scams and threats. According to the firm, the industry lost over $1 billion, representing 296 phishing scams, an increase of 21% from 2023â€™s data.
McAfee, another security firm, discovered malware in September 2024 that affected Android mobile phones. The malware called SpyAgent appears to be a legitimate Android app, but it was a scam that affected nearly 300 fake apps. This malware uses Optical Character Recognition (OCR) to scan images and steal personal information, including crypto passcodes.
Last September 19th, 2024, Decentraland lost access to its social media page. After controlling Decentralandâ€™s Twitter/X account, hackers used it to promote phishing activities, luring unsuspecting users to click on fake links. Users who click on these fake links have lost some or most of their digital assets due to malware.
For OKX, there have been no reports on how many users were affected or if these fake browser extensions have compromised their digital assets.
Featured image from SCMP, chart from TradingView
